summary: G. Robert Blakey was the Chief Counsel and Staff Director for the House Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA). The documents provided are payroll and certification reports from the U.S. House of Representatives detailing the salaries and positions of the HSCA staff from 1977 to 1979. Blakey's name appears on these documents as the head of the committee, indicating his leadership role in the investigation into the JFK assassination. The documents span from November 1977 to March 1979, reflecting the period of Blakey's active involvement in leading the HSCA.
significance: As Chief Counsel and Staff Director for the HSCA, G. Robert Blakey played a central role in the investigation into the assassination of JFK. His leadership was crucial in directing the committee's research, hearings, and final conclusions regarding the assassination.
